title: How to Make a Bounty Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180°C/350ºF.
steps.description: Grease the baking tin and line with baking paper.

steps.headline: Using an electric mixer, whisk the egg whites and salt until stiff.
steps.description: Gradually add the sugar and whisk until stiff and shiny.

steps.headline: Using a spatula, carefully fold in the coconut.
Pour the mixture into the prepared pan.
Reduce the oven to 150°C/300ºF.
steps.description: Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until the meringue is dry and light golden. The baking time is approximate and depends on your oven; check and continue baking if necessary. You can reduce the oven to 130°C/266ºF to prevent it over-browning.

steps.headline: Remove the meringue from the oven and cool completely.
steps.description: When cooled, cut lengthwise into 3 equal pieces.

steps.headline: Cook the egg yolks and sugar in a double boiler over low heat.
steps.description: Cook until a thick cream forms.

steps.headline: Add the chocolate and milk.
steps.description: Stir until the chocolate is melted. Remove from the heat and allow to cool completely.

steps.headline: Beat the butter with an electric mixer until fluffy, then beat in the cooled chocolate cream.
Layer the meringue pieces and chocolate cream straight onto the serving plate.
Spread the remaining chocolate cream around the sides of the cake.
Refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight to firm.
steps.description: Once firm, it is ready to serve. To serve, cut slices as for any cake.

text: Making the meringue Preheat the oven to 180°C/350ºF. Grease the baking tin and line with baking paper. Using an electric mixer, whisk the egg whites and salt until stiff. Gradually add the sugar and whisk until stiff and shiny. Using a spatula, carefully fold in the coconut.  Pour the mixture into the prepared pan.  Reduce the oven to 150°C/300ºF. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until the meringue is dry and light golden. The baking time is approximate and depends on your oven; check and continue baking if necessary. You can reduce the oven to 130°C/266ºF to prevent it over-browning. Remove the meringue from the oven and cool completely. When cooled, cut lengthwise into 3 equal pieces. Making the chocolate cream Cook the egg yolks and sugar in a double boiler over low heat. Cook until a thick cream forms. Add the chocolate and milk. Stir until the chocolate is melted. Remove from the heat and allow to cool completely. Beat the butter with an electric mixer until fluffy, then beat in the cooled chocolate cream.  Assembling the Bounty cake Layer the meringue pieces and chocolate cream straight onto the serving plate. Finish with the chocolate cream. Spread the remaining chocolate cream around the sides of the cake.  Refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight to firm. Once firm, it is ready to serve. To serve, cut slices as for any cake.
